category.description: Newspapers

vatRateResults.comment:
Newspapers or journals supplied electronically (other than publications wholly or predominantly devoted to advertising and other than publications wholly or predominantly consisting of video content or audible music) are subject to 8% VAT rate regardless of CPA code.
As regards CN codes: 4902 (excluding regional or local periodicals), 8523 (only newspapers or journals on physical means of support), CPA code 91.01 (only lending of newspapers on physical means of support by libraries)

code.description: Funeral and related services

category.description: Supply of services by undertakers and cremation services, and the supply of goods related thereto
Pharmaceutical products used for medical and veterinary purposes, including products used for contraception and female sanitary protection, and absorbent hygiene products

vatRateResults.comment: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CN codes to those products. Pursuant to Article 41(2),146ef(1)(2) item 14 of Annex 3 to Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax reduced rate is applied to pharmaceutical products admitted to trading in the territory of Poland in accordance with the provisions of Act of 6 September 2001-Pharmaceutical Law and those that have obtained a permit issued by the Council of the EU or the European Commission (regardless of CN).

category.description: Medical equipment, appliances, devices, items, aids and protective gear, including health protection masks, normally intended for use in health care or for the use of the disabled, goods essential to compensate and overcome disability, as well as the adaptation, repair, rental and leasing of such goods

vatRateResults.comment: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CN codes with respect to those items. Pursuant to Article 41(2), 146ef(1)(2), item 13 of Annex 3 to Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax reduced rate is applied to medical devices, accessories for medical devices, systems and procedure packs within the meaning of the Regulation (EU)2017/745 of The European Parliament and of the Council of 5 April2017 on medical devices,  admitted to trading in the territory of Poland

category.description: Admission to shows, theatres, circuses, fairs, amusement parks, concerts, museums, zoos, cinemas, exhibitions and similar cultural events and facilities or access to the live-streaming of those events or visits or both

vatRateResults.comment: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes with respect to those services. Pursuant to Article 41(2), 146ef(1)(2), item 64, 65, 66, 68 of Annex 3 to Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax reduced rate is applied to admission to (regardless of CPA codes): artistic performances,including circus performances, cultural facilities;amusement parks,theme parks, discos, dance halls; libraries, archives, museums and other cultural services; other services related to leisure.

category.description: Reception of radio and television broadcasting services and webcasting of such programmes provided by a media service provider; internet access services provided as part of digitalisation policy, defined by Member States

vatRateResults.comment: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes to those services. Pursuant to Article 41(2), 146ef(1)(2),item 48 of Annex 3 to Act of 11March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax, the 8% rate is applied to services, other than electronic services (regardless of CPA codes), consisting in enabling reception of TV and radio programmes, within the meaning of Radio and TV Broadcasting regulations,by means of reception facilities,excluding rental of films and programmes at a time chosen by the recipient.

category.description: Supply of services by writers, composers and performing artists, or of the royalties due to them

vatRateResults.comment: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes with respect to those services. Pursuant to Article 41(2), 146ef(1)(2) item 63 of Annex 3 to Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax reduced rate is applied to services of authors and performers within the meaning of the Act of 4 February 1994 on copyright and related rights remunerated in the form of fees for the transfer or licensing of copyrights or rights to artistic performance (regardless of CPA codes).

category.description: Supply and construction, of housing, as part of a social policy, as defined by the Member States; renovation and alteration, including demolition and reconstruction, and repairing of housing and private dwellings; letting of immovable property for residential use

vatRateResults.comment: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes to those services. The 8% rate is applied to services regarding building structures or parts thereof included in house-construction covered by a social housing programme within the meaning of and in line with the rules laid down in Article 41, paragraphs 12-12e of Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax.

category.description: The renovation and repairing of public and other buildings used for activities in the public interest

vatRateResults.comment: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes to those services. The 8% rate is applied to services regarding building structures or parts thereof included in house-construction covered by a social housing programme within the meaning of and in line with the rules laid down in Article 41, paragraphs 12-12e of Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax.

category.description: Admission to sporting events or access to the live-streaming of those events or both; use of sporting facilities, and the supply of sport or physical exercise classes also when live-streamed

vatRateResults.comment: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes with respect to those services. Pursuant to Article 41(2), 146ef(1)(2), item 67 of Annex 3 to Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax the VAT reduced rate is applied to admission to sporting events regardless of CPA codes.
